title: If you tell someone 'Next time you will regret it.', is that a threat? - Quora

response.answer_text: Im pretty sure the prosecutor could get it addressed as a threat. Its not legal to intimidate, scare, theeaten or harass others. However if I were to receive such a message, knowing that I have upset someone in a particular way, I would take it as a warning. Sort of like saying, “you already did me wrong once and this is your free pass. Do me wrong like that again and you can expect consequences.” Some people are implying physical injury, but not everyone. Someone may be implying legal action, lawsuit, or they know from experience that you will beat yourself up for years. You must know exactly what they are talking about. Accept responsibility, offer a genuine apology, and buy this threatening individual a beer. If you did something accidentally to offend them, that needs to be addressed. Just be humble. Someone who wants to hurt you, seriously, won't give 2 warnings. Time heals most wounds. Good luck.

To get the meaning as to whether its a threat i believe there are a few things to consider. i know that its not what is said but how it is said. To support this i reflect on statement overtones. Was this advice or feedback. What was the event which led to these words. )Perception. is also key. .Was the sayer experiences valid
